SEARCH
Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.mailbox.index

Class MessageIndexEntry

java.lang.Object
org.bluezoo.gumdrop.mailbox.index.MessageIndexEntry
public class MessageIndexEntry extends Object
A single entry in the message index containing all searchable metadata for one message.

The entry uses a property descriptor format where fixed-size descriptors (offset + length) appear first, followed by variable-length data. This allows fast field access without parsing the entire entry.

All string values are stored in lowercase for case-insensitive searching. The original values can always be retrieved from the message itself.

Binary Format

 FIXED HEADER (48 bytes):
   uid: 8 bytes
   messageNumber: 4 bytes
   size: 8 bytes
   internalDate: 8 bytes (millis since epoch)
   sentDate: 8 bytes (millis since epoch)
   flags: 1 byte (bit flags)
   reserved: 3 bytes
   descriptorCount: 4 bytes
   variableDataSize: 4 bytes
 
 PROPERTY DESCRIPTORS (N x 8 bytes):
   Each: offset(4) + length(4) relative to variable data start
   Order: location, from, to, cc, bcc, subject, messageId, keywords
 
 VARIABLE DATA:
   String data in order matching descriptors
Author:
Chris Burdess

  • Constructor Details

    • MessageIndexEntry

      public MessageIndexEntry()
      Creates a new empty index entry.

    • MessageIndexEntry

      public MessageIndexEntry(long uid, int messageNumber, long size, long internalDate, long sentDate, Set<Flag> flags, String location, String from, String to, String cc, String bcc, String subject, String messageId, String keywords)
      Creates a new index entry with the specified values.
      Parameters:
      uid - the message UID
      messageNumber - the message sequence number
      size - the message size in bytes
      internalDate - the internal date as millis since epoch
      sentDate - the sent date as millis since epoch
      flags - the message flags
      location - the message location (filename or offset)
      from - the From header value (lowercase)
      to - the To header value (lowercase)
      cc - the Cc header value (lowercase)
      bcc - the Bcc header value (lowercase)
      subject - the Subject header value (lowercase)
      messageId - the Message-ID header value (lowercase)
      keywords - comma-separated keywords (lowercase)
